revised_title: Observations on the January 1760 Comet by James Short
tldr: James Short observes a comet in January 1760 and provides details about its appearance, size, and motion. He notes that the comet's nucleus is small and visible through a two-foot reflector telescope, with a motion of about 2 degrees per day. Short also mentions the absence of a tail and concludes that the comet is going down towards the sun.
